org.apache.hadoop.fs.shell

Class CopyCommands.AppendToFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable
    Enclosing class:
    CopyCommands

    public static class CopyCommands.AppendToFile
extends CommandWithDestination
    Append the contents of one or more local files to a remote file.

      • expandArgument

        protected List<PathData> expandArgument(String arg)
                                 throws IOException
        Description copied from class: Command
        Expand the given argument into a list of PathData objects. The default behavior is to expand globs. Commands may override to perform other expansions on an argument.
        Overrides:
        expandArgument in class Command
        Parameters:
        arg - string pattern to expand
        Returns:
        list of PathData objects
        Throws:
        IOException - if anything goes wrong...

      • processOptions

        protected void processOptions(LinkedList<String> args)
                       throws IOException
        Description copied from class: Command
        Must be implemented by commands to process the command line flags and check the bounds of the remaining arguments. If an IllegalArgumentException is thrown, the FsShell object will print the short usage of the command.
        Overrides:
        processOptions in class Command
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
        Throws:
        IOException

      • processArguments

        protected void processArguments(LinkedList<PathData> args)
                         throws IOException
        Description copied from class: Command
        Processes the command's list of expanded arguments. Command.processArgument(PathData) will be invoked with each item in the list. The loop catches IOExceptions, increments the error count, and displays the exception.
        Overrides:
        processArguments in class CommandWithDestination
        Parameters:
        args - a list of PathData to process
        Throws:
        IOException - if anything goes wrong...
